channel.title: Cellular Phones on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Cellular Phones on 0x000216

item.title: Solstice Before The Solstice
item.description: You don’t have to wait for the winter solstice to experience the Samsung Solstice, a touchscreen phone designed for social networking. This sleek phone boasts a vibrant 3-inch color touchscreen with tactile feedback and customizable app widgets for easy access to platforms like Facebook and MySpace. Staying connected is effortless with the Solstice’s virtual keyboard and high-resolution screen, perfect for messaging. Its slim, half-inch profile, achieved through advanced virtual technology, surpasses bulkier models with slide-out keyboards.

item.title: Xperience the Sony Ericsson Xperia X10
item.description: The Xperia X10 might be the perfect smartphone you’ve been looking for. It boasts an 8.1 Megapixel camera and a 4-inch touchscreen, which begs the question: do you really need to carry a separate camera? The Xperia’s camera eliminates that need with features like flash, 16x zoom, touch focus, geo-tagging, smile detection, and a ‘send to web’ option. It’s adaptable for landscape, portrait, night, beach, and various other settings. You can even edit photos directly on the phone using apps from the Android Market.

item.title: BlackBerry Torch Fires Up Mobile Business
item.description: The BlackBerry Torch symbolizes a new era in mobile business communication, much like the Olympic torch marks the start of the Games. This smartphone combines a touch screen with a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and introduces the BlackBerry 6 operating system. BlackBerry highlights the new OS’s ability to aggregate social media and RSS feeds, enable faster web browsing with multiple open tabs, provide universal search functionality, offer enhanced multimedia with a YouTube app, and ensure easy setup and personalization with a user-friendly design.

item.title: Shine On, LG, Shine On
item.description: Looking for a sleek and stylish device that’s more than just a pretty face? The LG Shine, available in vibrant red or classic black, is an engineering marvel that combines the functionality of a camera, media player, and cell phone all in one. Encased in attractive stainless steel, the LG Shine is a quad-band GSM phone compatible with AT&T’s 3G network. Its unique 2.2-inch mirror LCD provides a wide viewing angle and adds to its sleek appeal.

item.title: Samsung Intercept Android Phone Goes NASCAR
item.description: What’s both thrilling and fast-paced, almost too much to handle? NASCAR is a fitting example, but so is the Samsung Intercept Android phone. And surprisingly, they’re connected! The Samsung Intercept M910 for Sprint is a dual phone, offering both a large 3-inch touchscreen display and a slide-out QWERTY keyboard with spacious keys for efficient typing and texting. As an Android 2.1 phone, it offers access to thousands of customizable apps from the Android market.

item.title: Drowning In A Sea Of Free Cell Phones
item.description: Your cell phone contract ends every two years, allowing you to explore new options. Many people take advantage of this because they’re unhappy with their current provider or want to upgrade to the latest technology. While constantly upgrading your phone can be expensive, there’s a way to get the newest models without breaking the bank. You can find the most recent phones for little to no cost if you know where to look.

item.title: Cyber Monday Cell Phone Deals
item.description: The best deals on cell phones can be found online, especially during sales like Cyber Monday. These limited-time offers on free and discounted phones are valid until midnight today, Monday. For a limited time, get a free BlackBerry Bold 9700 for AT&T after an instant online discount. This offer includes a bonus of free activation for up to five lines, making it perfect for family plans. Prefer a different BlackBerry? The BlackBerry Curve in Titanium or silver is also available.

item.title: How BlackBerry Touch Screen Technology Works
item.description: The BlackBerry Storm is a unique addition to the BlackBerry lineup, featuring a touch screen instead of the traditional physical QWERTY keyboard. Though the keyboard is now virtual, it still aims to provide a tactile experience. Why this change? Primarily, to accommodate a larger display screen without increasing the phone’s overall size. To achieve this, the physical keyboard was removed, leaving only essential call, menu, and navigation buttons below the screen.

item.title: The BlackBerry Storm Just Blew In at a Lower Price
item.description: Don’t worry if you missed out on getting a BlackBerry Storm in stores. You can buy one online from Cell Phone Plans Finder with free shipping. Although I can’t disclose the price here, you can easily find it on the cellphone special offers page. You can then order the phone with your preferred Verizon Wireless service package, all delivered directly to you without shipping fees. The BlackBerry Storm 9530 Black, the first BlackBerry with a touch keyboard, offers a unique experience for those accustomed to physical keys.

item.title: T-Mobile G1 Google Android Phone Gets Vocal
item.description: Choosing your next smartphone can be tough. Touchscreen phones like Apple’s iPhone, the BlackBerry Bold, and Samsung Delve are appealing, but some prefer a physical QWERTY keyboard. The BlackBerry Pearl’s trackball navigation is another option. Connectivity matters too, with 3G being desirable but not always accessible. WiFi capability for fast web browsing is also important. The HTC-built G1 for T-Mobile might be the solution if you want it all. This “Android Phone,” marking Google’s entry into mobile wireless, operates on T-Mobile’s network, offering quad-band service and various data features.

item.title: They Buy Used Cell Phones
item.description: What’s the smartest way to handle your old cell phone when you upgrade to a new one and get a new plan? While you might be tempted to discard it or let it gather dust in a drawer, selling it immediately is the financially savvy choice. Used cell phones depreciate rapidly, so time is of the essence to maximize your return. To determine your old phone’s worth, locate it on our list and provide details about its condition and any included accessories.

item.title: BlackBerry 8830 is World Class
item.description: Verizon Wireless has engineered a BlackBerry that functions domestically and internationally. This is notable because Verizon uses the CDMA network in the US, while the rest of the world primarily uses GSM. Previously, this difference prevented Verizon phones from roaming internationally. To solve this, Verizon created a device with both CDMA and GSM capabilities. In the US, the CDMA component accesses the 800 and 1900 MHz bands, including EV-DO broadband. Outside the US, the GSM component accesses the 900 and 1800 MHz bands, including GPRS broadband.

item.title: Phoneless in a Strange Land
item.description: We depend so heavily on our cell phones that we rarely consider what we’d do if they were unavailable or malfunctioning. What are your options in such situations? Cell phone failures can occur for various reasons: damage, battery depletion, traveling to a location without service, or attempting international calls not covered by your plan. So, what’s the alternative? Using hotel or public phones can result in unexpectedly high charges, especially for international calls.

item.title: Cell Phone Bill Shock Is So Easy To Avoid
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission is looking into new regulations due to a high volume of complaints regarding unexpected cell phone charges. While this intervention is welcomed by those who have faced this issue, understanding how to avoid such situations is key. “Bill shock” refers to the unpleasant surprise of discovering unexpectedly high charges on your cell phone bill, often leaving you in disbelief and frantically searching for errors. While billing mistakes can occur, these charges are typically accurate, stemming from a lack of awareness regarding contract details or exceeding usage limits, often unknowingly.

item.title: Recycle Your BlackBerry Phone For Cash
item.description: You can make money off your old BlackBerry phone instead of throwing it away. Even without a service plan, your old BlackBerry might be worth a significant amount of money depending on its model, age, and condition. Selling it yourself can be a hassle, but there’s an easier way. An electronics recycling company will pay cash for used BlackBerry phones and other cell phone models. To see if yours qualifies, visit their website and search for your BlackBerry model.

item.title: DROID vs DROID
item.description: The DROID phone, running Google’s Android operating system, actually has two versions produced by different companies with distinct specifications. So, it’s crucial to differentiate between the two. The first DROID, manufactured by Motorola for Verizon Wireless, is a touchscreen QWERTY smartphone utilizing the Android 2.0 operating system. This innovative device was recognized as Time.com’s “Top Gadget of 2009”. This top-tier DROID boasts a 5.0-megapixel camera, doubling as a camcorder, with features like geo-tagging, auto-stabilization, flash, and built-in editing tools.

item.title: The LG Lotus is Square to Be Hip
item.description: The LG Lotus LX600, a new and innovative phone in the mobile market, boasts a unique square design. Don’t let its shape fool you; this phone is powerful and designed for messaging. The LG Lotus LX600 is slim, lightweight, and square. It flips open to reveal a full, backlit QWERTY keyboard. Despite this feature, it remains compact, even compared to typical messaging smartphones. The LG Lotus has a lot to offer.

item.title: T-Mobile G2 With Google is 4G
item.description: T-Mobile is raising the bar for smartphones with its new G2, a Google phone that seamlessly integrates with Google Voice. This allows for voicemails to be converted to text and read like emails or texts. Powered by Android 2.2, the G2 boasts a 3.7-inch full touch screen with seven customizable home panels. Users can personalize their experience with thousands of apps and widgets from the Android Market. One of the G2’s standout features is its Adobe Flash Player, unlike a well-known competitor.

item.title: Research Your Cell Phone Online
item.description: It’s time to think about your cell phone options when your contract expires. Instead of just visiting electronics stores or carrier outlets, try exploring your choices online. Online research offers convenience and a pressure-free environment. You can browse at your own pace without feeling pressured by salespeople. More importantly, you’ll find significant price savings online due to lower overhead costs. You can get the same service plans online as you would in a store, often at reduced prices.

item.title: Going Incognito With SANYO and Sprint
item.description: When you need a phone for discreet texting, the SANYO Incognito from Sprint is the perfect choice. Its sleek, minimalist design resembles a small, black monolith. Don’t be fooled by its understated appearance, though, as this phone is packed with features. The mirrored shell conceals a monochrome display and essential buttons for making calls. Open the SANYO Incognito to reveal a full QWERTY keyboard with generously sized keys, perfect for rapid texting.

item.title: Samsung Omnia Smartphone for Smart People
item.description: “Omnia” means “all” in Latin, a fitting name for a high-tech wireless device designed for mobile professionals. The Samsung Omnia is a cutting-edge smartphone using the Windows Mobile 6.1 Pro operating system. It boasts a complete HTML web browser, Opera Mobile, on a 3.2-inch LCD touchscreen enhanced with Samsung TouchWiz technology. This technology provides tactile feedback through slight vibrations, while an accelerometer automatically adjusts the display based on the phone’s orientation.

item.title: Fascinated By The Samsung Fascinate
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy S series is a highly sought-after line of smartphones, offering a combination of style and advanced technology. The Samsung Fascinate, available through Verizon Wireless, is the newest member of this family. The Fascinate lives up to its name with a vivid 4-inch Super AMOLED display that’s easily viewable indoors and out. Its 1 GHz Hummingbird processor ensures smooth handling of demanding multimedia applications. The phone also boasts a 5-megapixel camera with autofocus and HD video recording capabilities, complemented by a DivX video player and an MP3 music player.

item.title: When You Call My Equinox I See Purple
item.description: With the new Sony Ericsson Equinox Carbon cell phone for T-Mobile, you’ll know who’s calling just by its color. This phone goes beyond Caller ID with its pulsating caller colors. No need to anxiously stare at your phone waiting for a call – just set it down and discreetly watch for your personalized color. You can assign five different colors, like purple, amber, or sapphire, to specific contacts. This way, you can easily see who’s calling with a quick glance, or even pretend you didn’t notice that unwanted call.

item.title: The LG Versa-tile Phone
item.description: LG has launched the Versa VX9600, a phone that combines the benefits of a touchscreen with a physical keyboard. The LG Versa initially resembles many popular touchscreen phones. However, it sets itself apart with a unique accessory: a detachable QWERTY keyboard. This keyboard, equal in size to the phone, comes in a case that can be easily attached or removed. This design provides flexibility. Users can opt for the virtual keyboard in standalone mode or connect the physical keyboard for a more tactile typing experience.

item.title: An Android Phone to Devour
item.description: Interested in getting a Google Android smartphone? The Motorola DEVOUR Silver might be the one for you. This Android 1.6 smartphone features a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and a 3.1-inch touchscreen, all within a sleek silver design. The DEVOUR uses MOTOBLUR, a service that seamlessly syncs your messages, status updates, and contacts directly to your customizable home screens. This eliminates the need to log in or open individual apps, giving you instant access to your information.

item.title: LG enV2 Sparks Envy Too
item.description: The LG enV, nicknamed the “envy phone,” certainly attracted attention. Its successor, the enV2 VX9100, takes it up a notch, especially for those who love texting, gaming, and enjoying media on their phone. The standout feature of the enV2 is its hidden full QWERTY keyboard. No need to fumble with a virtual keyboard on this phone! It boasts a real keyboard with comfortably sized keys. Keep your enV2 closed for calls, just like any other standard phone.

item.title: Samsung Memoir Phone Captures Memories
item.description: We all know the feeling: the best moments always seem to happen when you’re without a camera. That’s why a new cell phone with a built-in camera sounds appealing. While not as high-quality as a dedicated camera, it’s certainly better than nothing. The Samsung Memoir eliminates this dilemma by combining a cell phone and a high-quality camera. Designed for both casual and serious photographers, this touch screen phone boasts an impressive 8.

item.title: From Here to Samsung Eternity
item.description: It’s a frigid winter day with howling winds and accumulating snow outside. However, right here before me, I’m captivated by a Hawaiian beach scene playing on a screen. A young couple enjoys the crashing waves. It’s so realistic that I’m tempted to step into the picture and join them on the warm sand. Despite knowing it’s just a TV screen, I feel a noticeable warmth. This captivating scene effectively blocks out the dreary winter weather outside my window, showcasing the impressive power of visual suggestion.

item.title: BlackBerry Shows its Curve in Pink
item.description: Who says productivity can’t be stylish? Why not combine technology and beauty in the business world? It’s definitely possible! The BlackBerry Curve 8330 Pink for Verizon Wireless is a perfect example. This device deserves a spot in a movie, maybe titled “Pretty in Pink”—although that title is already taken, it perfectly captures the essence of this phone. This classic BlackBerry delivers on productivity while boasting an elegant curved design and a lovely pink exterior.

item.title: Delving Into Alltel's Delve
item.description: Samsung’s latest touchscreen phone, the Samsung Delve R800 Black for Alltel, boasts a slim design and is packed with features. Its cutting-edge technology caters to both professional and personal needs. The standout feature is the responsive touchscreen, which provides access to phone controls and a virtual QWERTY keyboard. Additionally, you can use voice commands to open over a dozen applications. The Delve offers both touch and voice interaction for user convenience.

item.title: GoPhones For Hurricane Gustav
item.description: During the preparations for Hurricane Gustav, AT&T gave out over 2,000 GoPhones with $15 of pre-loaded airtime to Gulf Coast evacuees. This act of generosity brought attention to the GoPhone and its potential use as an emergency phone. AT&T’s GoPhone isn’t a specific phone model but a prepaid cellular service. Unlike traditional cell phone plans that require contracts and monthly fees regardless of usage, GoPhone lets you pay for airtime in advance.

item.title: HTC Aria Social Networking Smartphone
item.description: If you’re looking for a way to stay connected, forget dogs – get FriendStream! This service lets you interact with friends through Facebook, Twitter, and Flickr, all from the HTC Aria, a cutting-edge Android smartphone. The Aria boasts a sleek, seamless design crafted from a single piece of black aluminum. It’s compact enough for your pocket yet powerful enough for work and play. Its sizable 3.2-inch touchscreen features pinch-to-zoom functionality, automatically adjusting text size for comfortable website browsing.

item.title: Red, Red, LG Vu Wine
item.description: Everyone enjoys a nice wine with dinner, but what about in business or on the go? It’s perfectly acceptable when that “wine” is the new touchscreen phone available from AT&T. This “red wine” phone boasts more features than a full-bodied Cabernet. Its compact size of 4.3 x 2.1 x 0.5 inches makes it easy to carry in your pocket or bag. You read that correctly – this device is only half an inch thin!
